security: Disclosure of specific operational roles and inquiries could compromise ongoing or future intelligence activities.
summary: This document is a transcript of an interview with William K. Harvey, conducted by David W. Belin, concerning his background and knowledge of assassination plots within the CIA.
summary_one_paragraph: On May 1, 1975, David W. Belin interviewed William K. Harvey regarding his CIA background and any knowledge of assassination plans within the agency. Harvey confirmed his roles in the Soviet Intelligence Branch, as Station Chief in Berlin and Rome, and his periods on the Foreign Service of State roles. Harvey denied any personal knowledge of assassination plans or operations concerning Patrice Lumumba or any other foreign leader, outside of Fidel Castro.
title: Letter/Enclosures
